definitions.definition: The inedible parts of a grain-producing plant.
definitions.example: To separate out the chaff, early cultures tossed baskets of grain into the air and let the wind blow away the lighter chaff.

definitions.definition: Straw or hay cut up fine for the food of cattle.
Any excess or unwanted material, resource, or person; anything worthless.
Light jesting talk; banter; raillery.
Loose material, e.g. small strips of aluminum foil dropped from aircraft, intended to interfere with radar detection.
To use light, idle language by way of fun or ridicule; to banter.
To make fun of; to turn into ridicule by addressing in ironical or bantering language; to quiz.
To make better, or improve, something perceived to be in a negative condition.
definitions.example: They offered some compromises in an effort to ameliorate the situation.

definitions.definition: To become better; improve.
In the United States Army, a non-commissioned officer ranking above sergeant first class and below sergeant major; equal in rank to a master sergeant but with greater command authority.

In the United States Marine Corps, a non-commissioned officer ranking above gunnery sergeant and below sergeant major or master gunnery sergeant; equal in rank to a master sergeant, but with command rather than technical responsibilities.
In the United States Air Force, an appointment (not a rank) for the senior member of enlisted personnel in a squadron or other unit. The appointment is usually held by a master sergeant.
A British dessert made from sliced white bread layered in a deep bowl with stewed or macerated berries.
An image made in the skin with ink and a needle.
A method of decorating the skin by inserting colored substances under the surface with a sharp instrument (usually a solenoid-driven needle).
To apply a tattoo to (someone or something).
To hit the ball hard, as if to figuratively leave a tattoo on the ball.
definitions.example: Jones tattoos one into the gap in left; that will clear the bases.

definitions.definition: A signal played five minutes before taps (lights out).
A signal by drum or bugle ordering soldiers to return to their quarters.
A military display or pageant.
To tap rhythmically on, to drum.
A breed of pony from India; a pony of that breed.
A European species of flatfish having dull brown colouring with reddish-brown blotches; fluke, European flounder, Platichthys flesus.
Any of various flatfish of the family Pleuronectidae or Bothidae.
A bootmaker's tool for crimping boot fronts.
To flop around as a fish out of water.
To make clumsy attempts to move or regain one's balance.
definitions.example: Robert yanked Connie's leg vigorously, causing her to flounder and eventually fall.

definitions.definition: To act clumsily or confused; to struggle or be flustered.
definitions.example: He gave a good speech, but floundered when audience members asked questions he could not answer well.

definitions.definition: To be in serious difficulty.

Originally, the DuPont company trade name for polyamide, a copolymer whose molecules consist of alternating diamine and dicarboxylic acid monomers bonded together; now generically used for this type of polymer.
(in the plural) A stocking originally fabricated from nylon; also used generically for any long, sheer stocking worn on a woman's legs.
definitions.example: I tore a hole in my nylons while walking home through the woods.

definitions.definition: (with "the") A feeling of nervousness or fear.
definitions.example: Staying in the haunted house gave me the willies.

definitions.definition: Any of various deciduous trees or shrubs in the genus Salix, in the willow family Salicaceae, found primarily on moist soils in cooler zones in the northern hemisphere.
The wood of these trees.
A cricket bat.
(1800s) The baseball bat.
A rotating spiked drum used to open and clean cotton heads.
A willow basket.
A fish basket.
(hypocoristic) the penis.
Term of abuse.
A person who is manipulated into serving as a useful agent without knowing it.
A sanctuary dedicated to the Ancient Greek and Roman god Pluto, usually at a location producing poisonous emissions, believed to represent an entrance to the underworld.
The transuranic chemical element with atomic number 94 and symbol Pu: a silvery-gray radioactive actinide metal that tarnishes when exposed to air.
Gaming with one or more dice.
A die.
That which has been diced.
definitions.example: Cut onions, carrots and celery into medium dice.

definitions.definition: To play dice.
To cut into small cubes.
To ornament with squares, diamonds, or cubes.
A regular polyhedron, usually a cube, with numbers or symbols on each side and used in games of chance.
That which is, or might be, determined, by a throw of the die; hazard; chance.
(plural also dies) An oblong chip fractured from a semiconductor wafer engineered to perform as an independent device or integrated circuit.
Having many mountains; characterized by mountains; of the nature of a mountain; rough (terrain); rocky.
Resembling a mountain, especially in size; huge; towering.
(of a problem or task) Very difficult.
Inhabiting mountains; hence, barbarous.
An American feline carnivore (Felis pardalis) covered with blackish ocellated spots and blotches which are variously arranged.
To ooze or pass slowly through pores or other small openings, and in overly small quantities; said of liquids, etc.
definitions.example: The water steadily seeped in through the thirl.

definitions.definition: To enter or penetrate slowly; to spread or diffuse.
definitions.example: Fear began to seep into the local community over the contamination of their fishpond.

definitions.definition: To diminish or wane away slowly.
definitions.example: The resistance movement against the invaders had slowly  seeped away.

definitions.definition: A small mouthful of drink
To drink slowly, small mouthfuls at a time.
To drink a small quantity.
To taste the liquor of; to drink out of.
To consume slowly — in contrast to faster consumption, in contrast to zero consumption
To make sure and secure.
(followed by that or of) To give (someone) confidence in the trustworthiness of (something).
definitions.example: He assured of his commitment to her happiness.

definitions.definition: To guarantee, promise (to do something).
To reassure.
Guaranteed; secure.
Self-confident; self-assured; sure.
A long seat with a back, made to accommodate several persons at once; a sofa.
A vessel with a very long, sharp prow, carrying two or three masts with lateen sails, used in the Mediterranean.
The process of self-digestion by a cell through the action of enzymes originating within the same cell. Often a defensive and/or self-preservation measure.
A type of programmed cell death accomplished through self-digestion.
Self-consumption; the act of eating oneself.
The act of despairing or becoming desperate; a giving up of hope.
A state of despair, or utter hopelessness; abandonment of hope
Reckless fury.
To cause to suffer; to trouble, afflict. (Now chiefly in interrogative or indefinite constructions.)
definitions.example: Have some chicken soup. It's good for what ails you.

definitions.definition: To be ill; to suffer; to be troubled.
An ailment.
Sickly; sick; ill; unwell.
definitions.example: She cared for her ailing brother day in, day out.

definitions.definition: Any of several plants of the genus Lens, especially Lens culinaris, from southwest Asia, that have edible, lens-shaped seeds within flattened pods.
The seed of these plants, used as food.
The largest stringed instrument of the violin family.
The deepest of all male voices.
definitions.example: Voice of a double bass, or simply, a double bass.

definitions.definition: To pull (something) back, aside, or away.
To stop talking to, or interacting with, other people and start thinking thoughts that are not related to what is happening around.
To take back (a comment, etc); retract.
definitions.example: to withdraw false charges

definitions.definition: To remove, to stop providing (one's support, etc); to take out of service.
To extract (money from an account).
To retreat.
To be in withdrawal from an addictive drug etc.
Removed from circulation
definitions.example: a withdrawn library book

definitions.definition: Introverted; not inclined to interact with other people
definitions.example: a withdrawn child

definitions.definition: Any indigenous polytheistic religion.
definitions.example: Most people in that region practise their own form of paganism.

definitions.definition: Any of a class of religions often associated with nature rituals.
definitions.example: Various neopagan movements have arisen, each advancing its own form of paganism. Some are monotheist.

definitions.definition: Either of two New World vultures, Vultur gryphus of the Andes or Gymnogyps californianus, a nearly extinct vulture of the mountains of California.
A gold coin of some South American countries bearing the figure of one of these vultures.
An Argentinian short range ballistic missile.
In golf, four under par (quadruple birdie, triple eagle, or double albatross)

In vertebrates, including humans, a ductless vascular gland, located in the left upper abdomen near the stomach, which destroys old red blood cells, removes debris from the bloodstream, acts as a reservoir of blood, and produces lymphocytes.
(except in the set phrase "to vent one's spleen") A bad mood; spitefulness.
A sudden motion or action; a fit; a freak; a whim.
Melancholy; hypochondriacal affections.
A fit of immoderate laughter or merriment.
To dislike.
An area, open to the sky, partially or wholly surrounded by walls or buildings.
definitions.example: She sat in the courtyard, enjoying the garden.

definitions.definition: An electronic device for playing phonograph records.
Given to fighting; disposed to engage in combat; pugnacious.
definitions.example: His combative style leads to many arguments.

definitions.definition: A compact folding knife.
definitions.example: He kept a jack-knife in his pocket for various tasks.

definitions.definition: The front-dive pike, in which the body folds and unfolds.
definitions.example: It took me hundreds of dives to master even the simple jackknife

definitions.definition: A semi-trailer truck accident in which the vehicle mimics the closing of a jack-knife.
definitions.example: I have seen several jack-knives along that dangerous stretch of road.

definitions.definition: To fold in the middle, as a jackknife does.
definitions.example: The cat jackknifed in the air and landed gracefully on its feet.

definitions.definition: To cause a semi-trailer truck to fold like a jackknife in a traffic accident.
definitions.example: Before I knew what was happening, I'd jack-knifed the truck.

definitions.definition: A resampling method that applies estimators to all subsamples that each omit a single different group (possibly of a single datapoint) of the original sample to provide a sample distribution of the estimate.
A source of nourishment, such as food, that can be metabolized by an organism to give energy and build tissue.
Providing nourishment.
A flaky roll or pastry in a form of a crescent.
A slippery secretion from the lining of the mucous membranes.
A person with multiple duties or abilities, such as "writer-director", "actor-model", or "singer-songwriter".
A person whose ethnicity is a multi-word hyphenated term, such as "African-American".
To break a word at the end of a line according to the hyphenation rules by adding a hyphen on the end of the line.
To join words or syllables with a hyphen.
A mosque.
definitions.example: Any masjid where the practices are devoted absolutely to The God ALONE.

definitions.definition: One of a succession of niches or platforms, one above another, to hold ore which is thrown successively from platform to platform, and thus raised to a higher level.
To walk while shuffling or dragging the feet.
definitions.example: I wasn't too impressed with the fellow, when he shambled in unenthusiastically and an hour late.

definitions.definition: A road that is not frequently travelled
(by extension) an unpopular or arcane field of study
A system for reducing the driver's effort to steer, by using a power source to assist in turning the wheels.
A house together with surrounding land and buildings, especially on a farm; the property comprising these.
The place that is one's home.
A cluster of several houses occupied by an extended family.
The home or seat of a family; place of origin.
To acquire or settle on land as a homestead.
A short poetical composition proper to be set to music or sung; a lyric poem; especially, now, a poem characterized by sustained noble sentiment and appropriate dignity of style.
The quality of agreeing or corresponding; being suitable and appropriate.
A relation between two numbers indicating they give the same remainder when divided by some given number.
The quality of being isometric — roughly, the same measure and shape.
More generally: any equivalence relation defined on an algebraic structure which is preserved by operations defined by the structure.
Manioc (Manihot esculenta), a tropical plant which is the source of tapioca.
Tapioca, a starchy pulp made with manioc roots.

Nymphicus hollandicus, a small, rather atypical cockatoo with a distinctive pointed yellow crest. Comes in many color mutations such as White Face Gray, White Face Pearl, Fallow, Pearl Pied, Cinnamon Pearl, and White Face Pied. Native to Australia but most known in aviculture.
A type of dense, non-vascular connective tissue, usually found at the end of joints, the rib cage, the ear, the nose, in the throat and between intervertebral disks.
The area between the tee and the green, where the grass is cut short.
Any tract of land free from obstacles.
(Military) A channel either from offshore, in a river, or in a harbor that has enough depth to accommodate the draft of large vessels. (JP 4-01.6)
A navigable channel in a harbour, offshore etc; the usual course taken by vessels in such places.
An organ system that coordinates the activities of muscles, monitors organs, constructs and processes data received from the senses and initiates actions.
To persuade someone by spoken arguments.
Having elegance or taste or refinement in manners or dress.
Having a particular directing style or cinematography.
The wife of one's biological father, other than one's biological mother.
A viola, especially Viola tricolor, heartsease.
Speech that has a rising intonation at the end of a sentence, as if it were a question; upspeak.
To speak with a rising intonation at the end of a sentence, as if it were a question; to upspeak.
A celebration to mark the fiftieth anniversary of a marriage.
A vessel of wood, tin, plastic, etc., usually cylindrical and having a handle -- used especially for carrying liquids, for example water or milk; a bucket (sometimes with a cover).
definitions.example: The milkmaid carried a pail of milk in each hand.

definitions.definition: (In technical use) A closed (covered) cylindrical shipping container.

(grammar, strict sense) Any of a class of non-inflecting words typically employed to connect a following noun or a pronoun, in an adjectival or adverbial sense, with some other word: a particle used with a noun or pronoun (in English always in the objective case) to make a phrase limiting some other word.
A proposition; an exposition; a discourse.
To place in a location before some other event occurs.
definitions.example: It is important to preposition the material before turning on the machine.

definitions.definition: A rigid implement, often roughly y-shaped, that is fixed to one's heel for the purpose of prodding a horse. Often worn by, and emblematic of, the cowboy or the knight.
A jab given with the spurs.
Anything that inspires or motivates, as a spur does a horse.
An appendage or spike pointing rearward, near the foot, for instance that of a rooster.
Any protruding part connected at one end, for instance a highway that extends from another highway into a city.
Roots, tree roots.
A mountain that shoots from another mountain or range and extends some distance in a lateral direction, or at right angles.
A spiked iron worn by seamen upon the bottom of the boot, to enable them to stand upon the carcass of a whale to strip off the blubber.
A brace strengthening a post and some connected part, such as a rafter or crossbeam; a strut.
The short wooden buttress of a post.

A projection from the round base of a column, occupying the angle of a square plinth upon which the base rests, or bringing the bottom bed of the base to a nearly square form. It is generally carved in leafage.
Ergotized rye or other grain.
A wall in a fortification that crosses a part of a rampart and joins to an inner wall.
A piece of timber fixed on the bilgeways before launching, having the upper ends bolted to the vessel's side.
A curved piece of timber serving as a half to support the deck where a whole beam cannot be placed.
A branch of a vein.
A very short branch line of a railway line.
A short thin side shoot from a branch, especially one that bears fruit or, in conifers, the shoots that bear the leaves.
To prod (especially a horse) on the side or flank, with the intent to urge motion or haste, to gig.
To urge or encourage to action, or to a more vigorous pursuit of an object
To put spurs on.
definitions.example: to spur boots

definitions.definition: To press forward; to travel in great haste.
A tern.
A spurious tone, one that interferes with a signal in a circuit and is often masked underneath that signal.
The track of an animal, such as an otter; a spoor.
To ask, to inquire
The removal and examination of a sample of tissue, cells, or bodily fluid from a living body for diagnostic purposes.
definitions.example: We will need to perform a biopsy to determine whether the tumour is malignant or benign.

definitions.definition: To take a sample (a biopsy) for pathological examination.
definitions.example: They biopsied the lump but it turned out to be non-cancerous.

definitions.definition: To send spam (i.e. unsolicited electronic messages.)
To send spam (i.e. unsolicited electronic messages) to a person or entity.
(by extension) To use (a spell or ability) rapidly and repeatedly.
definitions.example: Stop spamming that special attack!

definitions.definition: To post the same text repeatedly with disruptive effect; to flood.
The act of sending unwanted electronic mail.
An unkind trick.
(in the plural) Unethical or illegal tactics used against an opponent.
To include so that it no longer has separate existence; to overwhelm; to cause to disappear as if by swallowing up; to incorporate; to assimilate; to take in and use up.
To engulf, as in water; to swallow up.
To suck up; to drink in; to imbibe, like a sponge or as the lacteals of the body; to chemically take in.
To take in energy and convert it, as
definitions.example: Heat, light, and electricity are absorbed in the substances into which they pass.

definitions.definition: To engross or engage wholly; to occupy fully
To occupy or consume time.
Assimilate mentally.
To assume or pay for as part of a commercial transaction.
To defray the costs.
To accept or purchase in quantity.
Fully occupied with one's thoughts; engrossed.
Something that has been absorbed, taken in, engulfed, imbibed, or assimilated.
An evergreen tree, of the genus Macadamia, native to Australia and cultivated in Hawaii.
The fruit of this tree; the macadamia nut.
A show requiring members of the public to telephone the studio.
A person who uses diet and exercise to build an aesthetically muscular physique, in order to compete in bodybuilding.
A member of the Nizari Ismaili Muslim community of the Alamut Period
Someone who intentionally kills a person, especially a professional who kills a public or political figure.
Any ruthless killer.
To assassinate.
The purified, dry form of an amine, especially an alkaloid natural product, that is normally used in solution.
(specifically) The purified, dry form of certain illegal drugs, especially cocaine.
To purify a drug by crystallization.
To use a purified drug, especially cocaine, by heating it and inhaling the fumes produced.
Type of singing done generally without instruments and harmony.
A short and simple melody, divided into two parts by double bars, to which unmetrical psalms, etc., are sung or recited. It is the most ancient form of choral music.
Twang; manner of speaking; a canting tone.
A repetitive song, typically an incantation or part of a ritual.
To sing, especially without instruments, and as applied to monophonic and pre-modern music.
To sing or intone sacred text.
To utter or repeat in a strongly rhythmical manner, especially as a group.
definitions.example: The football fans chanted insults at the referee.

definitions.definition: To sell horses fraudulently, exaggerating their merits.
Any kind of fantasy/science fiction crime-fighting character, often with supernatural powers or equipment, in popular children's and fantasy literature.
A small pool of water, usually on a path or road.
Stagnant or polluted water.
A homogeneous mixture of clay, water, and sometimes grit, used to line a canal or pond to make it watertight.
The ripple left by the withdrawal of an oar from the water.
To form a puddle.
To play or splash in a puddle.
Of butterflies, to congregate on a puddle or moist substance to pick up nutrients.
To process iron, gold, etc., by means of puddling.
To line a canal with puddle (clay).
To collect ideas, especially abstract concepts, into rough subtopics or categories, as in study, research or conversation.
To make (clay, loam, etc.) dense or close, by working it when wet, so as to render impervious to water.
To make foul or muddy; to pollute with dirt; to mix dirt with (water).
At the present moment.
definitions.example: I'm not feeling very good right now.

definitions.definition: Immediately.
definitions.example: You'd better get out of here right now!

definitions.definition: Digital text in which the reader may navigate related information through embedded hyperlinks.
A hypertext document.
A dome-shaped Inuit shelter, constructed of blocks cut from snow.
A cavity, or excavation, made in the snow by a seal, over its breathing hole in the sea ice.
A reinforced bunker for the storage of nuclear weapons.
(logistics) A kind of airfreight cargo container.
A fictitious narrative intended to enforce some useful truth or precept, usually with animals, etc. as characters; an apologue. Prototypically, Aesop's Fables.
Any story told to excite wonder; common talk; the theme of talk.
Fiction; untruth; falsehood.
The plot, story, or connected series of events forming the subject of an epic or dramatic poem.
To compose fables; hence, to write or speak fiction; to write or utter what is not true.
To make up; to devise, and speak of, as true or real; to tell of falsely; to recount in the form of a fable.
(with indefinite article) Something which should not or cannot be done.
Not functioning properly.
Of a place, not to be entered.
definitions.example: The noise and drunkenness made the area a no-go zone at night for families.

definitions.definition: A cold-blooded vertebrate of the class Reptilia.
A mean or grovelling person.
Creeping; moving on the belly, or by means of small and short legs.
Grovelling; low; vulgar.
definitions.example: a reptile race or crew; reptile vices

definitions.definition: An early radio receiver, having no electrical power supply except the radio waves themselves; it used a crystal of lead or cadmium sulphide and a wire (the cat's whisker) touching the crystal's surface.
Food that can be eaten with one's hands, as opposed to requiring utensils; often appetizers and snacks.
definitions.example: He didn't serve a full lunch or dinner at the party, but there was plenty of finger food to munch.

definitions.definition: A fine net, placed around a bed, in a window opening, etc., to provide protection against mosquitoes and other insects, and the diseases carried by them.
Nervy, jumpy, on edge
Having jitter, or unwanted signal characteristics.
definitions.example: jittery video playback

definitions.definition: Composure, self-possession or imperturbability especially when in a dangerous situation.
definitions.example: He handled the stressful situation with great sangfroid.

definitions.definition: Something that protrudes, sticks out, or sticks together; a cluster or blob; a mound or mass of no particular shape.
definitions.example: Stir the gravy until there are no more lumps.

definitions.definition: A group, set, or unit.
definitions.example: The money arrived all at once as one big lump sum payment.

definitions.definition: A small, shaped mass of sugar, typically about a teaspoonful.
definitions.example: Do you want one lump or two with your coffee?

definitions.definition: A dull or lazy person.
definitions.example: Don't just sit there like a lump.

definitions.definition: (as plural) A beating or verbal abuse.
definitions.example: He's taken his lumps over the years.

definitions.definition: A projection beneath the breech end of a gun barrel.
A kind of fish, the lumpsucker.
Food given to a tramp to be eaten on the road.
To treat as a single unit; to group together in a casual or chaotic manner (as if forming an ill-defined lump of the items).
definitions.example: People tend to lump turtles and tortoises together, when in fact they are different creatures.

definitions.definition: To bear a heavy or awkward burden; to carry something unwieldy from one place to another.
To hit or strike (a person).
The art and practice of preparing food for consumption, especially by the application of heat; cooking.
definitions.example: Henry was not very good at cookery and most of his meals ended up burned.

definitions.definition: A delicacy; a dainty.
Cooking tools or apparatus.
To infer by extending known information.
To estimate the value of a variable outside a known range from values within that range by assuming that the estimated value follows logically from the known ones
A mechanical device used to trim fingernails and toenails.
An act of sneezing.
To expel air as a reflex induced by an irritation in the nose.
To expel air as if the nose were irritated.
A syllable used in solfège to represent the fifth note of a major scale.
A shaft used to transmit rotary motion.
definitions.example: A windmill transmits motion to the ground level via a vertical driveshaft, which operates a water pump.
